message.content: This question requires an understanding of the relationship between food consumption and body weight. When an animal eats more food, it is likely to gain weight, thus increasing its heaviness. Option (B) is incorrect because drought refers to a lack of water and is not related to food consumption. Option (C) is incorrect because starvation refers to a lack of food, not an increase in food consumption. Option (D) is unrelated to food consumption and refers to sunlight, which is not directly related to the question.

This can lead to weight gain and an increase in heaviness. Option (B) is incorrect because drought is a period of dryness and lack of water, not related to food consumption. Option (C) is incorrect because starvation is the state of extreme malnutrition due to lack of food, not related to increased food consumption. Option (D) is unrelated to food consumption and does not increase as an animal eats more food.
